author: horizon1978
title: So much for such a little prize!
review:
Hello,

Son got this smaller set along Garmatron. And this little set is a must buy for everyone, even outside the Ninjago range.

It is cheap, comes with two minifigures (Kai with kimono design and a stone warrior scout), enough interesting parts, a nice build plus a whole lot of playability.


So, get it. :)

author: Ernst
title: Kai & Big Brother versus Mini Garmadon
review:
Overall 4 bricks : Although I'm not a big Ninjago fan myself (my son is) this is a nice set. It consists of 2 mini figures and some kind of Bionicle Ninjago warrior. It offers usefull parts if you like to built Bionicle figures, several weapons and the minifigures Kai and a "dwarf" Garmadon. Price varies from some 8 - 11 euro's MISB and gives a nice and playable set.

Building 4 bricks : The building is for the Bionicle figure. It's fun building and not too difficult, good instructions which are easy to follow. My 6 year old son did the job in some 15 minutes, the only obstacle for a real young builder are the stickers. Finished a nice result.

Parts 3 bricks : Parts are usefull if you like Bionicle's, for someone who is more into "buildings" it's a set you don't need really. You get 2 good minifigures and several usefull Ninjago weapons.

Playability 4 bricks : For the (mostly younger) Ninjago fans a set with good playability. For the more objective viewer no fair battle, a Dwarf with crossbow against a well armed Ninjago warrior with a robot companion. Very good if added with other Ninjago sets.

Value 5 bricks : An affordable set for the target group, I found it in webshops for € 8,00 and bought it in retail for €11,00 which is in my view ok for a set this size.

author: Hylocera
title: A must-have mech!
review:
This set is surprisingly fun to play with and poseable for a $10 set. It also provides about 1 piece to the dime; a very good deal these days.

The building was simple, standard body + limbs scheme, nothing too out of the ordinary.

The variety of parts in this set really made it stand out to me. First off, you get 3 golden katanas in this set, two that are used to decorate the top of the mech, and 1 as an extra part. I may be a little biased in saying this, since these are the first LEGO katanas of any color I have owned, but that is an amazing deal. I haven't really been keeping up with the new parts TLG has been making for HF and Ninjago, so about 50% of the parts I hadn't even seen before anywhere. I particularly liked this piece, this piece, and this piece, all three of which I can see being very useful in the future. The minifigures were elaborately printed, both with nice back printing and head accessories; the red straw hat on the bad guy was a nice touch. Finally, 1/4 of the bricks used in Kai's Fire Mech are pearl gold, a color which I have always wanted more of. I don't really like Ninjago as a theme, besides the fact that the protagonists all have awesome new ninja head pieces and an abundance of new weapons, but the parts really make these sets worth buying. I can easily see people MOCing purely in pearl gold with these new parts. One final highlight is this sword, very nicely done and extremely cool-looking.

The mech itself reminded me of the old Exo-Force 8111 River Dragon, although the two sets are really quite different. What Kai's mech has that Ha-ya-to's lacked is poseability. I had a lot of fun balancing it on one foot, doing handstands, etc. The feature that allows the mech to grab the archer dude which is shown on the back of the box also works very well.

Most of what needs to be said about value I already mentioned in parts. I was tempted to buy another one of these while at the store because of the great deal in terms of price and because of the nice minifigures. 9.794 cents (according to the Brickset sidebar) per piece is a great deal, something not seen very often today, not even back when pricier sets almost always gave 10 parts/dollar, a ratio I consider to be optimal.

In the end, this is a great set, definitely worth getting more than one because it is just plain awesome. :D

-D B

author: chrisbstm
title: Super cool
review: I managed to pick this up at a TRU near me and was hyped. I had previously bought the hero factory set 2233 Fangz hoping to make a minifigure mech with it, but lacked the necessary parts. Stumbling upon this set, I realized mine dreams had come true. Reds not my favorite color, but I thought everything looked good, and was well designed. The mech is pretty sturdy, and the ninja fits into place perfectly. The bad guy minifigure is printed all over pretty much, and looks menacing. I give this set a solid two thumbs up. It provides some pretty good mech building joint pieces, and isn't too expensive. Plus, you get  a ninja. Never have enough ninjas.

author: Super_Mario_64
title: Wham! Bam! Sorry to beat ya man!
review:
My little brother bought this set from Walmart and when he showed it to me, I was blown away.

Box/Instructions

I did'nt get to see the box because he ripped it while opening it. The instructions are a bit confusing but not too much.

Parts

The set comes with a lot of great parts the best being an extra golden katana.

Minifigures

Kai KX looks very good, his kimono slightly different from the others. The Stone Army Scout looks pretty good.( My mom described him as "Cute").

The build

The build was pretty easy for me, although my brother had some trouble with it.

The completed model

The completed model is awesome. Great for the price point.

Summary

I would reccomend this set to any Ninjago fan.

author: ant1234lego
title: KAI'S FIRE MECH VS THE STONE ARMY.
review:
KAI'S FIRE MECH

Out of 20 both mini paragraph are marked.

We start with the robot.

THE ROBOT!

When I built the robot I was surprised that the robot is pretty big for £7.99 and look at the hand: one of the hands has 4 epic missiles about to fire out. The other hand is can either hold the scout or the fire blade. The legs are tiny compared to the body that you put Kai in; this set has 6 stickers - 4 on the top of the Mech or the fire symbol on the wrist, the back of the robot is not as good as the front and the worst part is that the back is plain with some parts sticking out from it. I give the first paragraph a impressive 9.

THE MINIFIGURES

The minifigures are the best part of this set. First of all, Kai minifigure doesn’t come in any other set that makes him a rare figure. I like the design but I think it should have one of the shoulder plates (gold) like in some other sets, his legs just have a red belt - this is kind of plain, but a good figure still. Next, on to the Stone Army Scout: his arrows are rare only because they are red and other Stone Army figures also have a red hat like him. His body has a green circle in the middle of his chest with red ropes and he has tiny legs, so I give them a score of 8 and a half.

OVERALL!

So, for me overall this set can be given 17 and half marks, only 2 and half from a full score. I think the set is perfectly priced, figures are good and also a cool robot for Kai. This set can do with a few improvements but a good set overall.

author: Lint
title: Now THIS is a LEGO set
review:
The Skinny

Kai's Fire Mech is an excellent Lego set and should be made the poster child for how sets of this size-class should be modelled after. It is simple, yet stunning and is utterly constructable. The set includes the fire-mech (which takes design cues from Warhammer 40k 'Dreadnoughts'), lightning blade, Kai in a kimono and the (demonic? sorry I don't watch the show) crossbowman bad dwarf.

Pros

  • The fire mech looks stunning! It has an articulated hand for the lightning blade and a deadly looking flamethrower as the other.
  • Articulation of the mech is.. ahem... on fire! The ball joints coupled with a fairly uncluttered design of the mech give a high degree of mobility and hence super poseability.
  • No flick fires!
  • For a small set, the build is by no means a yawn. Lots of interesting construction elements to satisfy
  • Fantastic array of parts, golden blades, golden katanas,sculpted panels, vents and fingers, all in vibrant red and shiny gold. Except the metallic grey crossbow and orange translucent nozzles. Plenty of uncommon stuff you could use in a MOC.
  • They could have easily omitted it, but the set includes a bad demon crossbow dwarf who doesn't stand a chance.
  • All things considered the RRP is actually decent!

Cons

  • Stickers of course, though they look fantastic and are tastefully done.
  • A bit stingy with the spare parts. I think you get 1 katana, a single stud gold button and maybe a gold wedge and orange nozzle?

Conclusion

Buy this set if you haven't already. It has a lot of great parts, is inexpensive and displays so very well, either on it's own or as part of a larger display. It did not look at all out of place on the roof of my modular fire station lording it's penchant for arson over all of Legotown! I only wish they made similar mechs for the rest of the ninja's as I really love this base design. MOC idea maybe?

author: Odeinoichus
title: The Final Battle Has Begun.
review:
Set #70500 Kai’s Fire Mech: The smallest and cheapest set of 2013 Ninjago, this set is pretty neat for such a small price point. And as part of The Final Battle Sub-Theme it stands out as one of the better offerings. Why? Read on and find out.

Box/Instructions

Even with this smaller set the design for the box stands out as pure gold (heh, heh) and while there aren’t any real features to speak of the images on the box make the mech Kai’s using here really clever and fun looking.

The manual is rather short here, the steps are semi-repetitive as you build both sides of the mech’s limbs. However it’s serviceable and your typical small set instruction manual… I really do not understand why they make them so large that they have to fold them in half though. It’s been done for so long now though I doubt LEGO would change it for these smaller boxed sets.

Also of note, sticker sheet warning, if you’re really unlucky the set will include bent or creased stickers because there is no protection for them.

Parts

The parts in this set include some of the constraction build pieces, a lot of them actually are being used here for the mech arms and legs. Now some people complain about this, I however find this to be a clever use of these parts. It adds to their usefulness and allows for new and different designs compared to older mechs such as those found in the anime inspired Theme from earlier last decade.

You’ll also find some decent gold pieces and blades in this set.

Minifigures

2 in the set, a ninja and an enemy to fight, great for a quick build and battle time for the younger builders.

Stone Archer: These minifigures use the short legs, so unfortunately no leg printing. The torso is double-sided at least and the facial print is impressive, this time in yellow. Perhaps it’s a theme of the Stone Army, to denote rank. Lowest ranking foot soldiers yellow faces, higher ranking red and blue for in-between. I like that you get a red quiver in this set, that’s a nice unique colour for this accessory. The crossbow accessory might have been better served if it were the longbow, just because I’d like to see that accessory in this nice dark colour scheme.

Kai: Dressed in his elemental robes, this Kai is only available in this set if I’m not mistaken. He comes with all the standard printing we’ve seen in the past for the ninja, double-sided torso and leg printing, plus the gold marking on his mask He includes the fire elemental blade… I really can’t tell you enough how awesome that accessory is, there is so much potential there for other types of weapons I can’t wait to see how LEGO brings it back in the future.

The build

Because of the use of those Constraction parts there are less brick build aspects for the limbs, the hands and feet use more building with traditional bricks compared to the arms and legs. The build however is still fairly decent for a mech of this size. I liken it to an old Power Miner mech that I picked up back in the day, and unlike that one this one hasn’t cracked any of the ball and socket joints, so it’s already a better improvement.

My biggest complaint in the build for this set, stickers… Again you use an ungodly amount of stickers for the details, the fire print is all stickers when printed elements here would have been so much better, especially on the circle tiles where Kai’s symbol is found. Printing would have been a much nicer overall look for a set of this size compared to the overreliance on stickers.

The completed model

This is a fun little build that has a few design flaws. The first being the limited leg motion, due to the nature of the build and the use of thick red constraction shoulder armour pieces the legs can only achieve a few poses and have a tough time standing otherwise. The other flaw involves the cockpit/pilot’s seat, it is bare bones and doesn’t have much to protect Kai from attack.

I do like the use of gold katana and blades for dangerous detailing, while Kai could be picked off easily from long ranged attacks, if you try to deal with him up close you run the risk of being skewered. The extra extension handle for his elemental blade is a nice touch too, it allows the mech to have a weapon other than the fire shooting cannon on his other arm. Offensively he’s armed to the nines and can take on any comers, defensively he needs to work at it to ensure nothing gets past to knock him out of the pilot’s seat.

Overall opinion

A great and fun little build with some minor flaws, decent minifigures and accessories, interesting build choices. Overall I recommend picking this set up, buy two and you could MOC one larger mech that doesn’t suffer the mobility flaws of the shorter limbed official version. What’s next from this Theme? Well it’s big, it’s gold and it breathes fire.

author: Wreckagestudios
title: Kai's Fire Mech-Ok set
review: Kai's Fire Mech is the smallest of the Ninjago sets in 2013. It is the only set to include Kai. You can pose the mech in many different ways; it has ball joints in its ankles,legs and shoulders. Kai stands on the front of the mech and holds on to a handlebar piece. On its right hand it has a fire gun, which- unfortunately- you can not shoot. The mech can hold on to the fire blade in its left hand. This set comes with Kai in his kimono suit. He has a gold and red mask and his normal face with a scar across his left eye. His torso and legs are black with red printing on them. The stone warrior has short black legs, a gun-metal-grey crossbow and a red quiver of arrows. It has a yellow and black face and wears a red version of Sensei Wu's hat. Overall, I think this is an OK set.
